acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 from 96 hours LC50=2.39mg/L of the fish (Oryzias Latipest) (CERI/NITE Hazard Assessment Report, 2005).

acute_toxicity_dermal.hazard_statement: May be harmful in contact with skin
acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the testing data of rabbit LD50 (dermal route) of 2,335mg/kg (CER-NITE Hazard Data No.60 (2004)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "liquid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 value of 3,184ppm, equivalent to the testing data of rat LC50 (4-hour inhalation) of 11.4mg/L (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 2 (2003)), was lower than 90% of the saturated vapour concentration (110,000ppm) under a saturated vapour pressure of 11kPa (20degC), the substance was classified based on standard values expressed in ppm.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the testing data of rat LD50 (oral route) of 2,900mg/kg (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 2 (2003)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is classified as Category A3 by ACGIH (2001), Group 2B by IARC (1995).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since there was rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 90% (Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)) and the bio-accumulation was low (log Kow=0.73 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), it was claasified into Not classified.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: No data available Those containing stabilizers are classified into Class 3 (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods, UN#1301)

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: The flash point is -8degC (c.c.) (ICSC, 1999) and the boiling point is 72degC which is classified into Category 2. Those containing stabilizers are classified into Class 3 and Packing Group II (UN#1301) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests, negative data on germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (micronucleus tests), positive data on somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (micronucleus tests, chromosome aberration tests), and the absence of data on germ cell genotoxicity tests in vivo, described in CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.60 (2004), DFGOT vol.21 (2005), IARC 63 (1995), ATSDR (1992), and NTP DB (Access on February 2006).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not fluorine and chlorine), with the oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Not pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures; the auto-ignition temperature is 402degC (ICSC, 1999)

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rat and mouse reproductive toxicity and teratogenicity tests (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.60 (2004), IARC 63 (1995), ATSDR (1992)): The reproductive toxicity is nil, minimal or toxicologically insignificant.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though containing unsaturated bonds. Those containing stabilizers are classified into Class 3 and Packing Group II (UN#1301) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit eye irritation tests (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.60 (2004)): "severe irritant."

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit skin irritation tests (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.60 (2004)): "mild irritation."

skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
skin_sensitizer.rationale: Based on the description in the report on guinea pig skin sensitization tests (the Buehlar method) (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.60 (2004)) - Six out of 20 specimens are positive.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (respiratory system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "upper respiratory inflammation" (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 2 (2003)) and the evidence from animal studies including "pneumonia, rhinitis, atrophy of the nasal olfactory epithelium, atrophy of the mucus-secreting gland, atrophy and squamous metaplasia of the olfactory epithelium, basal cell hyperplasia" (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.60 (2004)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause respiratory irritation (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "respiratory irritation" (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.60 (2004). The substance is considered "irritating" to the respiratory tract.
